comments: I had her for 2 classes my freshman year. I thought she was very knowledgeable and enjoyed class discussions. Make sure to read because we had pop quizzes on the h.w. Used all books, so make sure to buy them. Wrote all essays, no tests. B+ in both classes

Does reply to emails & uses all textbooks assigned, so no loss there. However she is a terrible public speaker, making her lectures difficult to follow. DON\'T copy her lecture notes, they look like reminder notes to herself. Also seems to think that anybody conservative is a **** or being manipulated by ****s.

Dr. Bragg is an excellent professor. She is the most helpful professor at BU, she answers e-mails within an hour! Lectures engaging, clear, useful assignments. You will learn so much from attending class and discussion. Average amount of reading, uses all books she requires students to buy. Will miss her class very much!

Class consists of Powerpoint presentations and her talking. She\'s usually pretty clear, but her notes are just lines of text sprinkled randomly onto a slide with a photo or two--very little form. Does not like conservatives.
Great professor. Very clear, lectures are engaging and notes are helpful. Heavy focus on writing. Discussion and lecture attendance are necessary to pass this class.

she\'s a great lecturer and knows a lot abt. the subject. 2 papers plus a final paper. if u are a good writer u should do fine. she gives 2 midterms which arent too hard n plus she gives a study guide. theres a good amount of reading but most of it is interesting. i would recommend this last 2 anyone! its not hard to do well

Her lecture notes are a mess but the lectures themselves are always interesting to listen too (just difficult to write notes on). Easy tests but there are only two of them with TAs making up the rest with papers. She is a great prof.
she is adorable, and the class is rather simple, just do the readings and go to discussion. her notes are confusing, but if you pay attention and do the readings you will be fine. very easy grader
She just rambles on in class about things that will NOT pertain to her essay questions.

I really enjoyed her class, she\'s the kind of teacher that makes history fascinating because she goes into details and cultural aspects of the time. You should probably already like history, and plan on attending class because all the notes are in class and really are necessary when writing the essays.
Talk in class, and you\'ll get a good grade. Listen and take notes--she\'s really fair.

This lady should not be allowed to teach a classroom of college students, as she is not fit to do so. She is trained to be a historian and belongs in the museums, not in college level classrooms. If you need to take a history corse, I strongly advise NOT to take this class. (She is actually a backup professor)

Well, Lets start by saying im in the middle of writing a Paper for her class right now, and I fully know I will be receiving a 65 no matter how much effort I put into the paper because effort and grade are in no way related to grades in her class. She gives questions that can be widely interpreted and always has a problem with your paper.GoodLUCK
I dont think she is fair with grading essays. She is not clear about what she wants, also the essay questions that she gives are too complex so they usually dont make sense. I dont suggest her :/

i was looking forward to having a different visiting professor teach this class...so when she walked in on day 1 i was a bit upset -- but still, she\'s not a bad professor, she\'s very clear and extremely patient. her lectures became redundant though and she is a difficult in class essay grader. in the end, i\'d recommend her class b/c she\'s fair
